meanings.definition: One or more notes or tones preceding the first downbeat of a musical phrase.
meanings.sent1: The anacruses set the tone for the entire musical piece.
meanings.sent2: The composer added anacruses to create anticipation in the music.
meanings.sent3: The anacruses whispered a secret melody before the main tune began.
meanings.sent4: Like a gentle breeze before a storm, the anacruses hinted at the upcoming musical storm.
meanings.sent5: The anacruses danced lightly, leading the way for the rest of the notes to follow.

meanings.definition: A short introductory phrase or section at the beginning of a piece of music.
meanings.sent1: The anacruses introduced the melody with a soft touch.
meanings.sent2: In the music sheet, the anacruses were marked with a delicate symbol.
meanings.sent3: The anacruses played a quick game of tag before the main melody started.
meanings.sent4: Like a friendly wave, the anacruses greeted the listeners before the music began.
meanings.sent5: The anacruses peeked around the corner of the music, inviting the audience to listen further.

meanings.definition: A brief introduction or prelude before the main part of a composition.
meanings.sent1: The anacruses acted as a gentle knock on the door of the musical piece.
meanings.sent2: Before the grand entrance of the main melody, the anacruses whispered a preview.
meanings.sent3: The anacruses were like a small appetizer before the main musical feast.
meanings.sent4: Just like a trailer before a movie, the anacruses hinted at what was to come.
meanings.sent5: The anacruses were the opening act, warming up the audience for the main performance.
